Message.Title: Judge Sullivan : Did you boys make $67 million in illicit insider trading profits on nvda?

Topic.Title: Gartner report: Win 8 tablets will lag IOS and Android. MS Surface will lose out on consumers but succeed in enterprise

Message.Msg: Surface has no chance of taking any enterprise business away from full Win 8 Clover Trail Atom tablets as reviews all round the web are finding the latter better performing and actually cooler in temperature never mind their obvious advantage of full Windows legacy compatibility. umpcportalDOTcom/2012/11/review-samsung-ativ-smart-pc-500t hothardwareDOTcom/Reviews/Intel-Clovertrail-Atom-Z2760-Windows-8-Tablet-Performance-Preview anandtechDOTcom/show/6385/microsoft-surface-review/10

Topic.Title: Judge Sullivan : Did you boys make $67 million in illicit insider trading profits on nvda?

Message.Msg: So Best? This nvidia insider trading thing. It's a sign of bad nvidia management, right? If nvidia took better care of their hapless, downtrodded, likely underpaid and apparently malnourished Accounting folks, they wouldn't need to go selling nvidia insider information to the criminal trading cabal. And when nvidia is about to report their bad quarterly numbers, the Accounting folks don't go selling the information in advance. Who then short nvda stock, and make Obscene amounts of illicit trading profits. Did I mention? It looks like a case of bad nvidia management. They should pay their Accounting folks better. And Jen should buy 'em donuts and pizza from time to time.

Topic.Title: IHS/iSuppli tear down of Microsoft Surface RT

Message.Msg: Ibexx : 'I am glad Jen Hsun didn't accept the below-par price as it would've been a dangerous precedent to set - what would NVIDIA tell its others customers who paid the normal price of $25? The deep discount would've also dropped NV's gross margin precipitously and the mind-share of working with Amazon is simply NOT WORTH it. As an investor It's absolutely fine with me that Jen Hsun didn't give away Tegra 3 FREE to big customers who use their big volumes as tools to exploit their component suppliers - like Apple. ' http://finance.yahoo.com/mbview/threadview/;_ylt=At7_rYX5EYqlFhB9MwE9LJQLH4hG;_ylu=X3oDMTFqNXBlMjRpBG1pdANNZXNzYWdlIEJvYXJkcyB3aWRnZXQEcG9zAzEwBHNlYwNNZWRpYU1zZ0JvYXJkcw--;_ylg=X3oDMTFlamZvM2ZlBGludGwDdXMEbGFuZwNlbi11cwRwc3RhaWQDBHBzdGNhdAMEcHQDc2VjdGlvbnM-;_ylv=3?&bn=76c7c563-b32a-39d8-909c-72a2d17c90e1&tid=1347000810455-d5be72a6-97b2-4139-9956-467aa9b72663&mid=

Topic.Title: Judge Sullivan : Did you boys make $67 million in illicit insider trading profits on nvda?

Message.Msg: I don't think it's fair, Best. Not fair at all. That the big criminal trading cabals can simply Buy the news of a bad quarter direct from somebody in the nvidia Accounting department -- while the rest of us little people have to wait for the bad news to be officially released. And watch our nvda stock plunge. How are us little people ever gonna make $67 million trading nvda? Like those big criminal trading cabal guys did. It's not fair, Best. Not fair at all.

Topic.Title: MIPS sold to GPU designer Imagination, patents "monetized"

Message.Msg: AST consortium bought the patents for protection against ARM patents going forward... Imagination bought the company(engineers), probably gonna have their own ARM CPU cores to license... The ARM Mali GPU cores are a real threat to Imagination...

Topic.Title: Apple lost a patent case, opens yet another

Message.Msg: a judge threw out, yesterday, Apple's lawsuit against Google...

Topic.Title: MIPS sold to GPU designer Imagination, patents "monetized"

Message.Msg: IT bought MIPS for MIPS so it can become a differentiated future SoC player, it's not going to do ARM cpus when everybody else does it with their gpus. Smart move by IT as MIPS is the more advanced mobile RISC, already has 64-bit and is multi-threaded like all other serious cpu implementations these days. Pleased it is in relatively safe hands so it can keep the other ISAs honest going forward.

Topic.Title: MIPS sold to GPU designer Imagination, patents "monetized"

Message.Msg: "IT bought MIPS for MIPS so it can become a differentiated future SoC player," Hmmm...maybe your'e right... time will tell "MIPS is the more advanced mobile RISC, already has 64-bit and is multi-threaded like all other serious cpu implementations these days. " The new ARM64 ISA looks more MIPS like...

Topic.Title: MIPS sold to GPU designer Imagination, patents "monetized"

Message.Msg: It does indeed but where's the SMT ? ARM may have access to any MIPS SMT patents now so it should be able to develop it now but it missed a trick in not buying MIPS for a tiny $60m itself as it could have become a non-IDM ISA mobile monopoly then. Ah well, consumers have won instead ;-).

Topic.Title: MIPS sold to GPU designer Imagination, patents "monetized"

Message.Msg: "where's the SMT ? " Don't know... always felt ARM claimed low-power... but in truth, it was due to academic simplicity "it could have become a non-IDM ISA mobile monopoly " who knows... probably cause they think they're gonna do it anyway... what I never got it how ARM got to be such a big standard... instead of MIPS and with MIPS having a friendly licensing model for their customers...
They did better without a CEO...:)

Message.Title: The 4th largest smartphone vendor in China Yulong released their flagship phone 9960
Message.Msg: Guess what's inside this flagship phone just announced? The 4th largest smartphone vendor in China Yulong just announced their latest flagship phone HD 9960. It comes with 1.5Ghz Tegra 3, 4.7" 720P screen, dual SIM card slot. It will be sold by China Telecom, one of the largest telecom in China. techDOThexunDOTcomDOTtw/2012-11-07/147695495DOThtml

Message.Title: Digitimes Commentary : Is it a blessing for Asustek to have Google backing?
Message.Msg: Commentary: Is it a blessing for Asustek to have Google backing? Monica Chen, Taipei; Steve Shen, DIGITIMES [Wednesday 7 November 2012] In excerpts. Asustek Computer has seen its brand image improve in the US and Japan recently thanks to the launch of dual-branded Nexus 7 in cooperation with Google. Asustek is proud of its product design with regard to the Nexus 7, and also aims to capture the top-vendor ranking in the Android tablet segment. But it remains to be seen whether Asustek will be able to continue to expand its brand image based on the charm of the Nexus 7, since Google has announced its Nexus 10 in conjunction with Samsung Electronics. [The new Nexus 10 tablet will apparently be powered by a 1.7GHz Samsung Exynos 5 processor using the newest ARM Cortex-A15 architecture -- instead of the old nvidia Cortex-A9 Tegra 3. Samsung handily beat nvidia to market with the second-ever ARM Cortex-A15 chip -- Apple of course, was the First on the planet to do so.]. Google has been backing Asustek in the development of the Nexus 7, offering the Taiwan-based hardware vendor the priority to design-in its latest Android OS and to penetrate into the US tablet market jointly. But the skepticism about the merits of the Google-Asustek tie-up still remains, since Google has showed its intention to control the development of the Android market, optimizing the production of the 7-inch Nexus 7 at Asustek and the 10-inch model at Samsung. Furthermore, the latest market rumors also indicate that Google may also team up with Lenovo for penetrating into the China market. Does Google treat Asustek as a brand partner or an OEM supplier? John Lagerling, director of business development for Android, seems to have an answer to the question. When approached by the New York Times during a recent interview seeking a confirmation of Asustek's remarks that current shipments of the Nexus 7 have reached as many as one million units a month, Lagerling replied, "We haven't announced numbers. We typically don't allow our partners to announce numbers." The message clearly indicates that Google treats Asustek as an OEM partner, but not a dual-brand partner. In the worst-case scenario, Google may tie up with other vendors such as HTC and Lenovo to develop its next-generation Nexus tablets, which will place Asustek under fire from rivals vying for the Android tablet market. Asustek has estimated its tablet shipments to reach 6.3 million units in 2012, of which the Nexus 7 will account for over four million. In other words, shipments of Asustek's own brand Transformer and Padfone tablets are limited. Asustek's competitive advantage will wane further if it fails to win the design-in priority for the next-generation Nexus tablets." Looks like that nvidia tegra-powered Nexus 7 tablet was a one-hit wonder, boys. And Google is moving on to other suppliers -- like Samsung.

Topic.Title: Jeepers Best, Everybody else pays a dividend.

Message.Msg: Maybe when the analysts ask Jen about when the heck 19-year old nvidia is going to finally pay their first cash dividend, Jen can tell 'em, "We'll take it under advisement." It's a cheap way to make the shareholders feel a little better, right boys? Far far cheaper than Apple's brand-new $10.60 a share dividend.
